channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023100544
item.description:
Report E-2023100544

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: HOLLISTER
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 9, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately 467-gallons of product to the trailer interior, lift gate, and asphalt roadway. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel utilized a vacuum pump to transfer the undamaged product from the damaged tote to a new tote and secured for normal transport. Crews then deployed additional granular absorbent and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer floor, lift gate and asphalt roadway and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN3098 impacted material, including the damaged tote, was collected and containerized in nine (9) 55-gallon drums and were taken to RLC-SJE to be staged and added to the facility waste stream. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date for pressure washing of impacted asphalt and monitor waste at RLC-SJE. On Oct 11, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. The waste was still reacting and drums were left unsealed in an open trailer. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date to continue monitoring the waste at RLC-SJE. On Oct 12, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. There was olfactory evidence that the waste was still reacting and drums were left unsealed in an open trailer. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date to continue monitoring the waste at RLC-SJE. On Oct 13, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. The reaction had ceased. The impacted trailer was re-inspected and it was confirmed that no further remediation necessary at the direction of RLC personnel. AS personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date to secure the waste at RLC-SJE to be added to the facility waste stream. On Oct 16, 2023, AS personnel arrived on-site at RLC-SJE and inspected six (6) 55-gallon drums containing UN3098 impacted material. The reaction had ceased and drums were secured. RLC personnel took possession of nine (9) 55-gallon drums of waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023100503
item.description:
Report E-2023100503

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: WEST SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 4, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon drums of UN1263 was crushed due to a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. PES overpacked the two (2) damaged drums in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tolls; once collected, PES personnel utilized absorbent pads to remove any residual product. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and RLC took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report E-2023100498
item.description:
Report E-2023100498

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UKC experienced a UN2924 Pro-Flow 39 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-ounces of product released to the drum lid only due to a loose bung cap. The cap was re-secured, and the drum was wiped down. All impacted absorbent rags were containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.

  • Description: XPO Terminal Located at 3516 Kiessig Ave Sacramento, CA 95823, USA for a 1-gallon release of “Suma Cal-X” UN2031 from a damaged 1-gallon plastic jug on the trailer floor. Patriot Environmental responded and observed the release of 2- gallons of “Suma Cal-X” UN2031 from two damaged 1-gallon plastic jugs. The release Impacted an area on the trailer floor of 4’X 4'. No soil or drains were impacted. Patriot Environmental Recovered the “Suma Cal-X” UN2031 with absorbents and neutralizers. Patriot Environmental overpacked the damaged 55-gallon DM. Patriot Environmental reported that they created one 85-gallon DF and one 55-gallon overpack drum of waste. Patriot Environmental left the waste on site with XPO

  • Description: Operations Manager at 165 called in a trailer fire that occurred at 165. The trailer caught fire around 11:30 AM while the trailer was ~sitting stationary on the yard. The fire department was dispatched and extinguished the fire. Cura was contacted and a crew will be ~dispatched for remediation and proper disposal of the batteries. (WE ARE AWARE THAT BATTERIES DON"T HAVE A PACKING GROUP. OUR ~REPORTING SYSTEM FORCED US TO PICK A PACKING GROUP IN ORDER TO SUBMIT A REPORT)

Report X-2023070325

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: BARSTOW

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GATX 89137 was identified by Barstow Mechanical with a vapor release only. The cause of the release was identified as a deteriorated gasket. BNSF HM Responders secured the release by replacing the gasket and tightening the man way swing bolts. Estimated amount released is approximate for vapor.
